conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the bullet and the cars, taking into account their relative velocities.
The distance between two successive bullets in the air is calculated as s = v_0 * Δt_0.
The relative velocity of the bullet with respect to cart B is v_bullet, rel = v_0 + v_2.
The time t it takes for a bullet to travel the distance s relative to cart B is t = s / (v_0 + v_2).
Verify the time interval Δt_0 between successive bullets: Δt_0 = s / v_0.
Check consistency of time intervals: Δt_0 = (Δt_0 * (v_0 + v_2)) / v_0.
The time interval Δt_0 between successive bullets being fired is Δt_0 = s / v_0.
